publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-ÖyRothkuppelraumduring T III MQ 49 (on the fragment), T III MQR 22 (on the frame)

seg.seg: If he meets him, he is not glad and he hides the thing in secret.
If he meets him, he is not glad and he hides the thing in secret.
Er lobt ihn vor Augen, anderswo [aber] spricht er Tadel über ihn ..., er lobt seine Feinde, sein Wissen leugnet er ab [und] freut sich nicht über [seinen] Besitz.
He praises him before [his] eyes, elsewhere he speaks censure over him ..., he praises his enemies, his knowledge he denies [and] is not pleased by [his] possessions.

p.note: On IDP, recto and verso are reversed.
